pros: Good place to work in Ohio
cons: Salaries and compensation could be improved

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Hiram, OH
pros: Very personable, easy to go places, easy to form relationships
cons: Lack of resources, location isn't great

review_title: Plenty of heart but you're generally on your own
pros: The people who have stuck at Hiram are dedicated and kind. They believe in the place. They make great colleagues and there's a sense of common purpose among them. Some of the leadership is excellent.
cons: There have been no raises in at least ten years. Compensation is completely uncompetitive for the sector. Student affairs operates on a culture of fear and if you have a good idea it's a sure bet leadership will take it for their own or punish you for innovating without permission.  The entire student affairs operation is antiquated and based on twenty-year old models. Students, faculty, and staff of color are continuously marginalized by the dominant power dynamics. Morale is low.

pros: Amazing group of people and mission-driven culture. Service centered work with lots of opportunity to innovate, learn, and grow
cons: Smaller overall pond compared to m any places in higher-ed

job_title: Campus Safety Officer in Hiram, OH

cons: They are on the edge of financial failure and everything is about keeping students in the chairs. This includes banning controversial topics in classroom instruction if they run counter to students leftist views.

job_title: Stage Hand Crew Member in Hiram, OH
pros: Great people and Teaches useful skills

review_title: Plenty of issues, but plenty of good stuff, too.
pros:
Lots of professional freedom.
Great students.
Lots of young and energetic faculty.
Being part of an OhioLINK school gives you access to a lot more resources than you might normally have.
cons:
Pay could be better, but it's not bad considering the local economy.
Morale was drooping, but it may swing back up with a new president on the horizon.
High handed management policies from upper management.
Communication issues all around.

job_title: Physics Lab Teaching Assistant in Hiram, OH
pros:
Friendly and Warm environment
People are helpful, professors are nice and always have open doors for students
Nice campus size and class sizes
Great opportunities
cons:
too small that it gets boring sometimes
less competitive due to the size of the school as well

pros: As a student, offices are pretty flexible with your schedule and working in more than one location (since each department is only allotted so much work study money to disburse to you) is a breeze!
cons: Some supervisors have the attitude that you should put your campus job before your school work, but they are rare.

pros: The college faculty and students  are nice .
cons: Upper management at Sodexo, are fickle, cheap, and have no people skills, they make you take days off so they don't have to pay overtime.  Even if you come in on a weekend.

job_title: Adjunct Professor of Physics in Hiram, OH
pros: The faculty and staff at Hiram College were wonderful, the campus is beautiful, and the students were great as well.
cons: I had a long commute from central Cleveland, Ohio to Hiram, Ohio, and that region gets some killer lake effect snow.

pros: Opportunities for interdisciplinary collaboration, beautiful field station, proximity to Cleveland, Akron, Youngstown, beautiful campus
cons: Lack of administrative support for the humanities, retirement benefits frozen several times, limited support for faculty scholarship, heavy emphasis on athletics in recruiting.

pros: Hiram is the friendliest place I've ever been. The staff is very supportive. The environment is amazing.
cons: The compensation needs to be updated.

pros: Flexible and educational, allowed me as a student to bring gain new skills
cons: low pay and sometimes there was a lack of things to do

pros: Great leadership experience for college students to work while attending college
cons: less authority and less exposure to the real world.

pros: I was a student when i worked there, the extra cash was nice
